title: Johan Ångström
text:
Johan Ångström (24 September 1813, Lögdö, <a href="Medelpad">Medelpad</a> – 19 January 1879, <a href="%C3%96rnsk%C3%B6ldsvik">Örnsköldsvik</a>) was a Swedish physician and <a href="bryologist">bryologist</a>.
He obtained his education in <a href="Uppsala">Uppsala</a>, and later practiced medicine in the communities of <a href="Lycksele">Lycksele</a> and <a href="%C3%96rnsk%C3%B6ldsvik">Örnsköldsvik</a>. With <a href="Fredrik%20Nylander">Fredrik Nylander</a> (1820-1880), he conducted botanical investigations in <a href="Lapland%20%28Finland%29">Lapland</a>, Finland and <a href="Karelia">Karelia</a>.
The <a href="moss">moss</a> genus "Aongstroemia" () in named in his honor. As a <a href="taxonomy%20%28biology%29">taxonomist</a>, he was the binomial authority of several plants within the genus "<a href="Botrychium">Botrychium</a>".
